alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:51PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Broward County through 515 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Sunny Isles Beach, or near Hallandale, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Pompano Beach, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Surfside, Hallandale, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Oakland Park, Aventura, Dania Beach, Sunny Isles Beach, Wilton Manors, Hillsboro Beach, Sea Ranch Lakes, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Port Everglades, Downtown Fort Lauderdale and Ojus. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
